intro: Maesa rheophytica, commonly known as the water maesa, is a rare and specialized plant species found in tropical montane cloud forests. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. This plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often near water sources such as streams or springs. Its root system is adapted to nutrient-poor soils, and it plays a role in stabilizing the forest floor. Due to habitat loss, Maesa rheophytica is considered an endangered species.
